intro: Erythroxylum pauferrense, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant produces small, red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and conservation efforts.
